title: Integrated Information Systems
description: Information systems in an integrated business environment. Collaborative learning with teams analyzing, designing, implementing and evaluating enterprise software. Determine and implement organizational policies and procedures to assure system performance. Coverage of business processes in the areas of accounting, procurement, human resource, production customer relationship and supply chain management. Ethical use of information systems in managing businesses. Role of information systems in conducting business in a socially responsible manner. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: BUS 391; Business and Economics majors must have formally declared their concentration to enroll
